--- title: 'Premier League Performance Metrics and Results: A Dynamic Analysis' subtitle: INFO 523 - Spring 2023 - Project 1 author: 'Tejas Bhawari, Gabriel Geffen, Ayesha Khatun, Alyssa Nether, Akash Srinivasan' title-slide-attributes: data-background-image: images/watercolour_sys02_img34_teacup-ocean.jpg data-background-size: stretch data-background-opacity: '0.7' data-slide-number: none format: revealjs: theme: - data/customtheming.scss editor: visual execute: echo: false --- # Question 1 ## Exploring the complex connections between in-game metrics Can these help forecast match outcomes? - Critical variables : - FTHG, FTAG, FTR, HS, AS, HST, AST, HF, AF, HY, AY, HR, AR. - Data preparation : - Combining match information with team-level season summaries. - Analysis : - Spliting data into appropriate sets then applying regression techniques. # Question 2 ## What if the matches ended at halftime?.. Do certain characteristics seen in successful teams results in more wins? - Critical variables : - FTHG, FTAG, FTR, HTHG, HTAG, HTR, HomeTeam, AwayTeam. - Data preparation : - Performing thorough checks and creating visualizations. - Analysis : - Creating a funtion to determine results of matches at halftime and using this recalibration as a new baseline of analysis. ## Code ::: {#b23eb323 .cell execution_count=4} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` OLS Regression Results ============================================================================== Dep. Variable: mpg R-squared: 0.073 Model: OLS Adj. R-squared: 0.070 Method: Least Squares F-statistic: 30.59 Date: Fri, 01 Mar 2024 Prob (F-statistic): 5.84e-08 Time: 19:16:16 Log-Likelihood: -1346.4 No. Observations: 392 AIC: 2697. Df Residuals: 390 BIC: 2705. No. 169. ============================================================================== Notes: [1] Standard Errors assume that the covariance matrix of the errors is correctly specified. ``` ::: ::: ## Plots ::: {#0569d1cd .cell execution_count=5} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](presentation_files/figure-revealjs/cell-6-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ## Plot and text ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} - Some text - goes here ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {#8d9db6dc .cell fig.width='5.5' execution_count=6} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](presentation_files/figure-revealjs/cell-7-output-1.png){} ::: ::: ::: ::: # A new section... ## Tables If you want to generate a table, make sure it is in the HTML format (instead of Markdown or other formats), e.g., ::: {#818c5612 .cell execution_count=7} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=14} \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n

You can use the display style with double dollar signs: ``` $$\bar{X}=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^nX_i$$ ``` $$ \bar{X}=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^nX_i $$ Limitations: 1. The source code of a LaTeX math expression must be in one line, unless it is inside a pair of double dollar signs, in which case the starting `$$` must appear in the very beginning of a line, followed immediately by a non-space character, and the ending `$$` must be at the end of a line, led by a non-space character; 2. There should not be spaces after the opening `$` or before the closing `$`. # Wrap up ## Feeling adventurous? - You are welcomed to use the default styling of the slides. In fact, that's what I expect majority of you will do. You will differentiate yourself with the content of your presentation. - But some of you might want to play around with slide styling. Some solutions for this can be found at https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/revealjs.
